Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Treading the path of Guru's percepts, a Sikh is freed from the fear of death. By keeping company of the holy Sangat (congregation) even vices like lust, anger, avarice, attachment and pride are shed.

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: By taking the refuge of Satguru, one destroys all effects of the past deeds. And beholding the God-like form of Satguru, the fear of death disappears.

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Abiding by the sermons of the Satguru, all desires and apprehensions vanish. By engrossing the mind in the holy words of the Guru, the mammon-gripped unconscious mind becomes alert.

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Even a subtle element of grace of the Satguru is no less than all the worldly treasures. By engrossing the mind in the word and Naam blessed by the Satguru, one achieves salvation while still alive and living life. (57)
